block.p: LEAD: The White House announced today that people who missed President Reagan's weekly Saturday radio speeches could call a recording of it later in the day, for a fee. Elizabeth Board, director of the White House television and radio office, announced plans for an experimental program in which the Presidential address will be available on a call-in basis from 12:30 P.M.

The White House announced today that people who missed President Reagan's weekly Saturday radio speeches could call a recording of it later in the day, for a fee.
